title: My allies are becoming a bigger problem than my enemies.
body:
Everytime someone has a lead  they instantly feel like they have to throw it. I  just played a game in which our adc got eight kills early and then did nothing but splitpush for the rest of the game, becoming a free bag of gold. The support (Leona) rushed Zz rot and Solari so her HP was minimal and couldn't tank or shield for shit. Sejuani was top EVERY TIME there was a dragon to fight for except for the last one, in which she jumped in 1vs4 when it was ALREADY dead. And Nautilus just fed their Zed. No matter how many times I pinged or I warned them they continued dying and getting caught. I tried to assist with ult ( I was GP) and keep my farm to stay relevant but it was hopeless. And of course nobody wanted to surrender.
I honestly dunno wtf I'm supposed to in this situation.

Welcome to the new LoL.
The game where the bad players have more negative impact than the good players can possibly have positive impact.

Having a bad teammate in your team rigth now is lethal. 

- Sometimes the enemy adc is 4-0 before reaching level 6. Insta lose the game.

- Sometimes your jungler do 0 ganks while the enemy jungler do 4 ganks. Insta lose the game.

- Someone in your team suddenly is 9-2, but then decides to start doing 1 vs 5 figthings and dying like an idiot. Insta lose the game. 

Rigth now to have some agency over the game you have to play ADC, support or jungle, and hope the other four players in your team are not braindead.
I have stopped listing as a support main because of that braindead point

-Shutdown gold is getting changed later on to only be given to people who participated in the shutdown; No more afk bot laners with 4 IQ getting a free 100 gold every now and then because your Zed mid suicides every 4 kills.

-A lot of items are having their power shifted so bot lane isn't the only lane to have impact mid-late, and specifically it's shifting more power to assassins and bruisers since IE won't just outright kill you in 2 autos (Or even one. Looking at you Vayne.)

-There was some talk about lowering the effectiveness of 'shield whores' ( {{champion:40}} {{champion:117}} and even to a lesser extent {{champion:43}} ) to help bring back tank initiator supports like {{champion:89}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:201}} and {{champion:111}} / {{champion:54}} if you wanna be saucy about it.

-A whisper in the wind also talked about some power creep regarding unnecessary strength of certain component combinations making ~2900 gold worth more than ~4000 gold when the other person has a completed item. (This is mainly because of how some completed items synergize specifically with different stats.)

Snowballing will be made more effective/less effective based on individual player skill with the shutdown gold changes, meaning if you are truly better than the fed player and outplay them to shut them down solo, you get ALL of the gold for it bringing you a LOT closer to where they are rather than having to split the gold with a support who is building full AP on Janna without an Ardent or Redemption and a jungler who has been executed by gromp twice. If you play exceedingly well and the rest of your team is garbage, you won't have them ambiently stealing gold from you left and right as you shut down the enemy team, giving you more to work with to carry if you're truly in an ELO too low for your skill level.

So just hold on. Hold tight. Be patient for these changes. League's gonna feel like it did season 3-4 ranked-wise.

After this many years I have zero faith that Riot will get it right.  The same problems have plagued ranked for years with no change.  Riot is too stubborn to realize that the very basis of how people are ranked is bad.  Matchmaking at it's very base level is bad.  The team focus in solo queue is bad.  Riot is putting a bandaid on a bullet hole that's been bleeding internally because they refuse to fix the real problems and instead only focus on the superficial.  Want to see how Riot makes changes?  Look at dynamic queue.

Dude, it was a normal game. People were probably testing out champions and were messing around.

If anything, you didn't do well either. You had 19% kill participation with a global ulti and only 7.5 cs/min on a champion that farms on auto pilot after trinity force. You also had very little damage dealt to champions, which probably means you were contributing nothing for your team.

Look at your own flaws before accusing your team.

My contribution to the team was not participating in suicidal teamfights or ambushes from which we got no benefits. I couldn't get trinity and farm 24/7 because I had to rush {{item:3156}}  because botlane kept being ganked by {{champion:99}}  despite my 589 warning pings (that's why she ended 10/1/17).
There's no difference if my team goes into a teamfight being 15 kills behind and die, or if we all go teamfight and die. Doesn't matter if my damage to champions stat grows, because we are giving them 1500 gold and potential free acces to objectives. If I don't participate in that suicide ritual at least I can clear waves and hopefully scale and carry, which in the end didn't happen.

Wait, you were playing mid GP vs Lux? Then, for starters, that's your fault. GP mid is suicide. You put yourself in a situation where you had to rush MR to deal with the lane, therefore you were unable to farm up and you were useless the entire game. Again, it seems like you made to many mistakes.

A sidenote, just because you pinged your bot lane that Lux is roaming, doesn't mean you did your job and played well. How about you try to deny that Lux from roaming in the first place? Bot lane isn't mid's bitch to back off at the first potential ping. You couldn't control your laner, and they snowballed because of it. Your fault.
It's my fault they put themselves in a 3 vs 2 situations even though I warned them. Ok. Oh, and everytime she roamed I pushed the lane so she would lose it.

So, after all that roaming she did, she still managed to outfarm you? 
In any case, I'm just giving you advice. I'm not gonna argue more, because I know most of the players on these boards will never listen to anything.

I know it's hard to climb with braindead teammates, but there are 3 types of teammates.
1. Decent players who know what they're doing 
2. Actually braindead (bonobo) auto-pilot players who farm and push towards tower, they usually consist of dying often, and blaming almost the whole team
3. Highly strong Ego players who think they know everything, but they make micro-mistakes that cost the team
What I would do usually is tell my teammates the issue with their lane and if they choose not to listen to me then it's fine. (Mob mentality) I'm the leader of my rank games, so I order people to do certain things, and I (text) my teammates what to do, and how to do something. If we're usually in a tough spot that's the case. When people see me make good calls (inferring u should make decent calls) people tend to follow you. -TR
